cards.name: Yoke of the Damned
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When a creature dies, destroy enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: The demon's yoke is part leash, part noose.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When a creature is put into a graveyard from play, destroy enchanted creature.

cards.name: Banefire
cards.text:
Banefire deals X damage to any target.
If X is 5 or more, this spell can't be countered and the damage can't be prevented.
cards.flavor: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.

rulings.text: To determine whether it can be countered and its damage can be prevented, Banefire checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent or the amount of damage it will actually deal.

Banefire can be targeted by spells that try to counter it regardless of what the value of X is. If X is 5 or more, those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Banefire won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.
If its target is illegal by the time Banefire tries to resolve, the spell isn't countered, but it doesn't resolve. The target won't be dealt damage.

cards.originalText:
Banefire deals X damage to target creature or player.
If X is 5 or more, Banefire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Bloodhall Ooze
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a black permanent, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodhall Ooze.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a green permanent, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodhall Ooze.
cards.flavor: A drop of blood spilled from the first dragon.

rulings.text: The "intervening 'if' clause" means that (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control a permanent of the specified color, and (2) the ability will do nothing unless you control a permanent of the specified color at the time it resolves.
A permanent that's both black and green will allow both abilities to trigger (as will separate black permanents and green permanents, of course).

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a black permanent, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodhall Ooze.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a green permanent, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodhall Ooze.

cards.name: Canyon Minotaur
cards.flavor: On Jund, the deep canyons were the best places to hide. When the goblins wandered into Naya, they found that was not so true.

cards.name: Dark Temper
cards.text: Dark Temper deals 2 damage to target creature. If you control a black permanent, destroy the creature instead.
cards.flavor: When you've got the temperament of a dragon, every argument is one you'll win.

rulings.text: This checks the colors of permanents you control as it resolves.

Dark Temper has a self-replacement effect, which applies before other prevention or replacement effects would. If you control a black permanent as Dark Temper resolves, it doesn't deal damage at all (so damage prevention or redirection effects would have no effect); it simply destroys the targeted creature.

cards.originalText: Dark Temper deals 2 damage to target creature. If you control a black permanent, destroy the creature instead.

cards.name: Dragonsoul Knight
cards.text:
First strike
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Dragonsoul Knight becomes a Dragon, gets +5/+3, and gains flying and trample.
cards.flavor: The farther he roamed from Jund and its dragons, the more he felt their essence in himself.

rulings.text: When Dragonsoul Knight's activated ability resolves, Dragonsoul Knight will gain flying and trample in addition to its other abilities. However, becoming a Dragon will make it lose all other creature types. It will no longer be a Human or a Knight.
If Dragonsoul Knight gains flying after blockers have been declared, it won't cause those blocks to change.
You can activate Dragonsoul Knight's ability more than once during a turn. The second time it resolves, it will probably have no visible effect other than giving Dragonsoul Knight another +5/+3.

cards.originalText:
First strike
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Dragonsoul Knight becomes a Dragon, gets +5/+3, and gains flying and trample.

cards.name: Fiery Fall
cards.text:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)
cards.flavor: Jund feasts on the unprepared.

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.originalText:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Goblin Razerunners
cards.text:
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin Razerunners.
At the beginning of your end step, you may have Goblin Razerunners deal damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Finding themselves in a new and unexplored world, they immediately set it on fire.

rulings.text: You don't count how many +1/+1 counters are on Goblin Razerunners until its triggered ability resolves.

If Goblin Razerunners leaves the battlefield after its ability triggers but before it resolves, the amount of damage it deals is equal to the number of +1/+1 counters that were on it as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin Razerunners.
At the end of your turn, you may have Goblin Razerunners deal damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target player.

cards.name: Hellspark Elemental
cards.text:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Hellspark Elemental.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At end of turn, sacrifice Hellspark Elemental.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to play. It gains haste. Remove it from the game at end of turn or if it would leave play. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Ignite Disorder
cards.text: Ignite Disorder deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target white and/or blue creatures.
cards.flavor: "Bant is a world imprisoned by polished stone and tyrannical rule. It yearns to strike back against those who restrain it."

rulings.text: The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 3.
You divide the damage as you cast Ignite Disorder, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
The number of targets chosen for Ignite Disorder must be at least 1 and at most 3. You divide the damage as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.originalText: Ignite Disorder deals 3 damage divided as you choose among any number of target white and/or blue creatures.

cards.name: Kranioceros
cards.text: {1}{W}: Kranioceros gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A surly beast, the kranioceros will raise its defenses at the smallest threat. Stay out of sight and downwind, or you'll disrupt its natural migrations."
—Ebrel, godtoucher mentor
cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Kranioceros gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Maniacal Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
cards.flavor: The spikes of sangrite made the goblin stronger, but they didn't make him any smarter.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

cards.name: Molten Frame
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact creature.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The metal filigree in his body glowed red-hot, and his flesh soon followed.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
Any permanent that's both an artifact and a creature is a legal target for Molten Frame.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact creature.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Quenchable Fire
cards.text: Quenchable Fire deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker. It deals an additional 3 damage to that player or planeswalker at the beginning of your next upkeep step unless that player or that planeswalker's controller pays {U} before that step.
cards.flavor: You'd better know how to pray for rain.

rulings.text: After Quenchable Fire resolves, the targeted player becomes able to perform a special action of paying {U}. This action may be performed any time the player has priority, and it doesn't use the stack. It may be performed only once, and only before your next upkeep begins. If the player has performed the action by then, the "deal an additional 3 damage" ability won't trigger. Otherwise, it will. If it triggers, the player can't stop it by paying {U}.

Quenchable Fire's delayed triggered ability (and the special action of paying {U}) will affect the player who was targeted by the spell, even if the original 3 damage is prevented or redirected to a different permanent or player.

cards.originalText: Quenchable Fire deals 3 damage to target player. It deals an additional 3 damage to that player at the beginning of your next upkeep step unless he or she pays {U} before that step.

cards.name: Rakka Mar
cards.text:
Haste
{R}, {T}: Create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with haste.
cards.flavor:
"The finest pawns are those with pawns of their own."
—Nicol Bolas
cards.originalText:
Haste
{R}, {T}: Put a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with haste into play.

cards.name: Toxic Iguanar
cards.text: Toxic Iguanar has deathtouch as long as you control a green permanent. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: There are no "weak" creatures on Jund. Even the smallest can strike a deadly blow.

rulings.text: As long as at least one permanent you control is the specified color, the ability will "work" and grant this creature the bonus. Otherwise, it won't have the bonus.

Whether Toxic Iguanar has deathtouch matters only when it deals damage (that is, at the point when its combat damage resolves, or at the point when a spell or ability that causes it to deal damage resolves). For example, if your only green permanent is a creature that receives lethal damage at the same time Toxic Iguanar deals damage to a creature, the deathtouch ability will still apply and the creature Toxic Iguanar dealt damage to will be destroyed.

cards.originalText: Toxic Iguanar has deathtouch as long as you control a green permanent. (Whenever it deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature.)

cards.name: Viashino Slaughtermaster
cards.text:
Double strike
{B}{G}: Viashino Slaughtermaster gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: "I'll fight two at once, and then lick their guts from my blades."

foreignNames.name: ヴィーアシーノの殺戮士

cards.originalText:
Double strike
{B}{G}: Viashino Slaughtermaster gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Volcanic Fallout
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"How can we outrun the sky?"
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

rulings.text: Volcanic Fallout can be targeted by spells that try to counter it (such as Countersquall). Those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Volcanic Fallout won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.

cards.originalText:
Volcanic Fallout can't be countered.
Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Voracious Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Voracious Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage to any target equal to twice the number of Goblins it devoured.

rulings.text: Voracious Dragon can devour any type of creatures, not just Goblins.

"The number of Goblins it devoured" means "The number of Goblins sacrificed as a result of its devour ability as it entered the battlefield." For each creature that Voracious Dragon devoured, this ability checks its creature type as it last existed on the battlefield to see if it was a Goblin at that time.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Devour 1 (As this comes into play, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature comes into play with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Voracious Dragon comes into play, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to twice the number of Goblins it devoured.

cards.name: Wandering Goblins
cards.text: Domain — {3}: Wandering Goblins gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: Tired of waiting for a dragon to eat them, some hardy goblins struck out to become meals for the unknown.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Domain {3}: Wandering Goblins gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Worldheart Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
You may cast Worldheart Phoenix from your graveyard by paying {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than paying its mana cost. If you do, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

rulings.text: Casting Worldheart Phoenix from your graveyard by paying its alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast it. You can cast it only at the normal time you could cast a creature spell.
If you cast Worldheart Phoenix this way, it is a spell and can be countered.

As soon as you start to cast Worldheart Phoenix from your graveyard, the card moves onto the stack. At that point, it's too late for an opponent to prevent you from casting it by removing it from your graveyard.

foreignNames.name: 世界心のフェニックス

cards.originalText:
Flying
You may play Worldheart Phoenix from your graveyard by paying {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than paying its mana cost. If you do, it comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Beacon Behemoth
cards.text: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When its smoky plumes light Naya's sky, every creature from the smallest pip fawn to the largest rannet heeds the warning.
cards.originalText: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Cliffrunner Behemoth
cards.text:
Cliffrunner Behemoth has haste as long as you control a red permanent.
Cliffrunner Behemoth has lifelink as long as you control a white permanent.
cards.flavor: It's revered for its power, celebrated for its grace, and feared for the avalanches triggered by its thunderous feet.

rulings.text: As long as at least one permanent you control is the specified color, the ability will "work" and grant this creature the bonus. Otherwise, it won't have the bonus.
Whether Cliffrunner Behemoth has haste matters only when attackers are declared. Once it's been declared as an attacker, it doesn't matter if it loses haste.

Whether Cliffrunner Behemoth has lifelink matters only when it deals damage (that is, at the point when its combat damage resolves, or at the point when a spell or ability that causes it to deal damage resolves). For example, if your only white permanent is a creature that receives lethal damage at the same time Cliffrunner Behemoth deals damage, the lifelink ability will still apply and you'll gain life.

cards.originalText:
Cliffrunner Behemoth has haste as long as you control a red permanent.
Cliffrunner Behemoth has lifelink as long as you control a white permanent.

cards.name: Cylian Sunsinger
cards.text: {R}{G}{W}: Cylian Sunsinger and each other creature with the same name as it get +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The sun shines bright upon the strong."

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, it gives the +3/+3 bonus to the source of the ability and each other creature that shares a name with that source, even if that source isn't actually named Cylian Sunsinger. This could happen if Skill Borrower gains this ability, or if Cylian Sunsinger's name is changed (due to Mirrorweave, perhaps) before the ability resolves.

If Cylian Sunsinger has left the battlefield by the time its ability resolves, its ability will affect each creature whose name is the same as the name Cylian Sunsinger had as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {R}{G}{W}: Cylian Sunsinger and each other creature with the same name as it get +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ember Weaver
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
As long as you control a red permanent, Ember Weaver gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
cards.flavor:
"Each night, the sun unravels and blows away. Each day, the spiders set a new one in the sky."
—Sunseeder myth

rulings.text: As long as at least one permanent you control is the specified color, the ability will "work" and grant this creature the bonus. Otherwise, it won't have the bonus.

Whether Ember Weaver has first strike matters only at the point that the normal combat damage step would begin, and only if there hasn't already been a first-strike combat damage step that turn. If any of your creatures has first strike at that point, a first-strike combat damage step is created. -- If Ember Weaver has first strike at that point, it will assign and deal combat damage during that step (even if it loses first strike before that damage is dealt) and it won't deal combat damage during the normal combat damage step. -- If Ember Weaver doesn't have first strike at that point, it will assign and deal its combat damage during the normal combat damage step (even if it gains first strike before then).

cards.originalText:
Reach (This can block creatures with flying.)
As long as you control a red permanent, Ember Weaver gets +1/+0 and has first strike.

cards.name: Filigree Fracture
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If that permanent was blue or black, draw a card.
cards.flavor: The sphinx tyrannized Bant until a rhox mage tested the hardiness of her shiny parts.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If that permanent was blue or black, draw a card.

cards.name: Gluttonous Slime
cards.text:
Flash
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
cards.flavor: On Jund, everything eventually ends up in something else's stomach.
cards.originalText:
Flash
Devour 1 (As this comes into play, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature comes into play with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Matca Rioters
cards.text: Domain — Matca Rioters's power and toughness are each equal to the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.flavor: When outsiders interrupted the matca championship, things got ugly.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.
Matca Rioters' ability is a "characteristic-defining ability." It applies at all times in all zones.

cards.originalText: Domain Matca Rioters's power and toughness are each equal to the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.name: Might of Alara
cards.text: Domain — Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: The combined strength of all five planes spawned creations none had seen before.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Domain Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Nacatl Savage
cards.text: Protection from artifacts
cards.flavor:
"Blades dull and armor dents. Marisi taught us that instinct is the only thing a true warrior needs."
—Ajani

rulings.text: "Protection from artifacts" means the following: -- Nacatl Savage can't be blocked by artifact creatures. -- Nacatl Savage can't be equipped. It also can't be enchanted by Auras that have somehow become artifacts in addition to enchantments. -- Nacatl Savage can't be targeted by abilities from artifact sources. -- All damage that would be dealt to Nacatl Savage by artifact sources is prevented.

cards.originalText: Protection from artifacts

cards.name: Noble Hierarch
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U}.
cards.flavor: She protects the sacred groves from blight, drought, and the Unbeholden.
cards.originalText:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Paleoloth
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Gods do not sleep soundly in the earth's embrace."
—Mayael the Anima

rulings.text: If Paleoloth and another creature with power 5 or greater enter the battlefield under your control at the same time, Paleoloth's triggered ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature with power 5 or greater comes into play under your control, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sacellum Archers
cards.text: {R}{W}, {T}: Sacellum Archers deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: "Our arrows are aimed not at the sacred behemoths but at those who dare to dream of such a trophy."
cards.originalText: {R}{W}, {T}: Sacellum Archers deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Scattershot Archer
cards.text: {T}: Scattershot Archer deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: To train her elves for war, Mayael would drop a sackful of acorns from the tree canopy. Each archer tried to split as many as possible before the acorns hit the forest floor below.
cards.originalText: {T}: Scattershot Archer deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Shard Convergence
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains card, an Island card, a Swamp card, and a Mountain card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Alara is broken no more.

rulings.text: You don't have to find all four cards.

Shard Convergence checks for cards with the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, and Mountain, not for cards with those names. You may find nonbasic land cards this way, as long as they have appropriate subtypes.

You may find "dual lands" with Shard Convergence. The Plains card you find, for example, can have a second subtype. What subtypes it has won't impact what other cards you can find. For example, you may find a Hallowed Fountain (which has subtypes Plains and Island) as the Plains card, and another Hallowed Fountain as the Island card.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a Plains card, an Island card, a Swamp card, and a Mountain card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Soul's Majesty
cards.text: Draw cards equal to the power of target creature you control.
cards.flavor: An avatar he sculpts of wisdom and strength.

rulings.text: Soul's Majesty's only target is the creature. If that creature becomes an illegal target by the time Soul's Majesty would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw any cards.

cards.originalText: Draw cards equal to the power of target creature you control.

cards.name: Spore Burst
cards.text: Domain — Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: Seeds from Jund don't drift gently on the wind. They get up and stampede.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Domain Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Sylvan Bounty
cards.text:
Target player gains 8 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)
cards.flavor: Some who scouted new lands chose to stay.

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.originalText:
Target player gains 8 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Thornling
cards.text:
{G}: Thornling gains haste until end of turn.
{G}: Thornling gains trample until end of turn.
{G}: Thornling gains indestructible until end of turn.
{1}: Thornling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}: Thornling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Lethal damage and effects that say "destroy" won't cause a creature with indestructible to be put into the graveyard. However, a creature with indestructible can be put into the graveyard for a number of reasons. The most likely reasons are if it's sacrificed, if it's legendary and another legendary creature with the same name is controlled by the same player, or if its toughness is 0 or less.

cards.originalText:
{G}: Thornling gains haste until end of turn.
{G}: Thornling gains trample until end of turn.
{G}: Thornling is indestructible this turn.
{1}: Thornling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}: Thornling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tukatongue Thallid
cards.text: When Tukatongue Thallid dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: Jund's thallids tried to disguise their deliciousness by covering themselves in spines harvested from the tukatongue tree.
cards.originalText: When Tukatongue Thallid is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: Wild Leotau
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Wild Leotau unless you pay {G}.
cards.flavor:
"Leotau that were born wild make the best mounts. It's like riding a thunderstorm."
—Rafiq of the Many
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Wild Leotau unless you pay {G}.

cards.name: Apocalypse Hydra
cards.text:
Apocalypse Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it. If X is 5 or more, it enters the battlefield with an additional X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Apocalypse Hydra: Apocalypse Hydra deals 1 damage to any target.

rulings.text: For example, if X is 4, Apocalypse Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it, but if X is 5, it enters the battlefield with ten +1/+1 counters on it.
The first ability checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent.

cards.originalText:
Apocalypse Hydra comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it. If X is 5 or more, it comes into play with an additional X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Apocalypse Hydra: Apocalypse Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Blood Tyrant
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, each player loses 1 life. Put a +1/+1 counter on Blood Tyrant for each 1 life lost this way.
Whenever a player loses the game, put five +1/+1 counters on Blood Tyrant.

rulings.text: Blood Tyrant's second ability causes each player to lose 1 life, including you. Blood Tyrant will count each player's life loss, including yours, when determining how many +1/+1 counters it gets.

Blood Tyrant's third ability will trigger no matter how a player loses the game: due to a state-based action (as a result of having a life total of 0 or less, trying to draw a card from an empty library, or having ten poison counters), a spell or ability that says that player loses the game, a concession, or a game loss awarded by a judge.

In a multiplayer game using the limited range of influence option (such as a Grand Melee game), if a spell or ability says that you win the game, it instead causes all of your opponents within your range of influence to lose the game. This is another way by which Blood Tyrant's third ability can trigger.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, each player loses 1 life. Put a +1/+1 counter on Blood Tyrant for each 1 life lost this way.
Whenever a player loses the game, put five +1/+1 counters on Blood Tyrant.

cards.name: Charnelhoard Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Charnelhoard Wurm deals damage to an opponent, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Jund's dragons hoard only sangrite crystals. Its wurms aren't so picky.

rulings.text: If Charnelhoard Wurm is dealt lethal damage at the same time it deals damage to an opponent, Charnelhoard Wurm will be in your graveyard by the time you put its ability on the stack. In that case, you can target it with its own ability.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Charnelhoard Wurm deals damage to an opponent, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Child of Alara
cards.text:
Trample
When Child of Alara dies, destroy all nonland permanents. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: The progeny of the Maelstrom shows no allegiance—and no mercy—to any of the five shards.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Child of Alara is put into a graveyard from play, destroy all nonland permanents. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Conflux
cards.text: Search your library for a white card, a blue card, a black card, a red card, and a green card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: After years of world-bending machinations, Bolas's triumph is at hand.

rulings.text: You don't have to find all five cards.

You may find multicolored cards with Conflux. The white card you find, for example, can be any number of colors, as long as white is one of them. What colors it is won't impact what other cards you can find. For example, you may find a white-blue card as the white card and another white-blue card as the blue card.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a white card, a blue card, a black card, a red card, and a green card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Countersquall
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Each of the twenty-three winds of Esper is named and chronicled, and every possible interaction with the flow of magic is exhaustively detailed.
cards.originalText: Counter target noncreature spell. Its controller loses 2 life.

cards.name: Elder Mastery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a player, that player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Taste his power, hunger for his command.

rulings.text: The last ability triggers from any damage dealt by the enchanted creature, not just combat damage.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a player, that player discards two cards.

cards.name: Esper Cormorants
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"The smiths of this land must be mad to reach so far and so high for another creature to decorate."
—Cagen Vargan, Jhessian sea scout
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Exploding Borders
cards.text: Domain — Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Exploding Borders deals X damage to target player or planeswalker, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.flavor: Reuniting a world is not a gentle process.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.
You do what the spell says in order, so you'll put a new basic land card onto the battlefield before you determine the value of X.
Exploding Borders will still deal damage even if you don't put a land card onto the battlefield.

Exploding Borders has only one target: the player. If that player becomes an illegal target by the time Exploding Borders would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't get to search for a basic land card.

cards.originalText: Domain Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play tapped, then shuffle your library. Exploding Borders deals X damage to target player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.name: Fusion Elemental
cards.flavor: As the shards merged into the Maelstrom, their mana energies fused into new monstrosities.

cards.name: Giltspire Avenger
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Destroy target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.
cards.flavor: "To trespass so far from home is to ask for a lonesome grave."
cards.originalText:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Destroy target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.

cards.name: Goblin Outlander
cards.text: Protection from white
cards.flavor: Egbol stared in wonder at Naya's landscape. So much to eat. So much to steal.
cards.originalText: Protection from white

cards.name: Gwafa Hazid, Profiteer
cards.text:
{W}{U}, {T}: Put a bribery counter on target creature you don't control. Its controller draws a card.
Creatures with bribery counters on them can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: "Everyone has a price."

rulings.text: If Gwafa Hazid leaves the battlefield, any bribery counters will remain where they are. However, without a Gwafa Hazid on the battlefield, creatures with bribery counters on them can attack and block as normal. If another Gwafa Hazid enters the battlefield, its ability will affect all creatures with bribery counters on them, including the ones that received counters from a different Gwafa Hazid.

Creatures with bribery counters on them can't be declared as attackers or blockers. However, if a bribery counter is put on a creature that's already been declared as an attacker or blocker, that creature will continue to attack or block that combat.

foreignNames.name: 成金、グヮファ・ハジード

cards.originalText:
{W}{U}, {T}: Put a bribery counter on target creature you don't control. Its controller draws a card.
Creatures with bribery counters on them can't attack or block.

cards.name: Hellkite Hatchling
cards.text:
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
Hellkite Hatchling has flying and trample if it devoured a creature.
cards.flavor: A killing machine from birth.

rulings.text: Hellkite Hatchling has flying and trample if at least one creature was sacrificed as a result of the Hatchling's devour ability as it entered the battlefield. It retains those abilities even if its +1/+1 counters are somehow removed.

If another creature becomes a copy of Hellkite Hatchling (due to Mirrorweave, for example), the second ability checks to see whether that creature — not the original Hellkite Hatchling — devoured a creature as it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Devour 1 (As this comes into play, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature comes into play with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
Hellkite Hatchling has flying and trample if it devoured a creature.

cards.name: Jhessian Balmgiver
cards.text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "You have two choices: heed my advice now or need my healing later."

rulings.text: After blockers have been declared, activating the second ability won't cause those blocks to change.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{T}: Target creature is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Knight of the Reliquary
cards.text:
Knight of the Reliquary gets +1/+1 for each land card in your graveyard.
{T}, Sacrifice a Forest or Plains: Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge of Bant's landscape and ruins is a weapon that the invaders can't comprehend."
—Elspeth

rulings.text: Knight of the Reliquary's first ability applies only while it's on the battlefield. In all other zones, it's a 2/2 creature.

The activated ability's cost checks the land's subtype, not its name. You can sacrifice a nonbasic land this way as long as it has the subtype Forest or Plains. Most nonbasic lands don't have basic land types, even if they produce colored mana. For example, Horizon Canopy is neither a Forest nor a Plains, while Temple Garden is both.

Sacrificing a Forest or Plains is part of the cost of Knight of the Reliquary's activated ability. Assuming that sacrificing the land puts it into your graveyard, Knight of the Reliquary's first ability will immediately give it an additional +1/+1 when that cost is paid because there'll be a new land card in your graveyard. Paying a cost can't be responded to (with Shock, for example).
Knight of the Reliquary's activated ability lets you find any land card, not just a basic land card.

cards.originalText:
Knight of the Reliquary gets +1/+1 for each land card in your graveyard.
{T}, Sacrifice a Forest or Plains: Search your library for a land card, put it into play, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Knotvine Mystic
cards.flavor: The elves of Naya were the last to acknowledge the massive shift of mana in their world.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{G}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Maelstrom Archangel
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Maelstrom Archangel deals combat damage to a player, you may cast a nonland card from your hand without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: There is no world where angels fear to tread.

rulings.text: If you want to cast a card this way, you cast it as part of the resolution of Maelstrom Angel's triggered ability. Timing restrictions based on the card's type (such as creature or sorcery) are ignored. Other casting restrictions are not (such as "Cast [this card] only before attackers are declared").
If you cast a card this way, you're casting it as a spell. It can be countered.
If you cast a card with X in its cost this way, X must be 0.

If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs, such as evoke or the alternative cost provided by the morph ability. However, you can pay optional additional costs, such as conspire, and you must still pay mandatory additional costs, such as the one on Goldmeadow Stalwart.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Maelstrom Archangel deals combat damage to a player, you may play a nonland card from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Magister Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
When Magister Sphinx enters the battlefield, target player's life total becomes 10.
cards.flavor: "These benighted worlds are thick with ignorance. I will educate them. They will listen, or they will die."

rulings.text: This ability is not optional.

For a player's life total to become 10, what actually happens is that the player gains or loses the appropriate amount of life. For example, if the targeted player's life total is 4 when this ability resolves, it will cause that player to gain 6 life; alternately, if the targeted player's life total is 17 when this ability resolves, it will cause that player to lose 7 life. Other cards that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, this ability basically causes the team's life total to become 10, but only the targeted player is considered to have actually gained or lost life.

foreignNames.name: 厳然たるスフィンクス

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Magister Sphinx comes into play, target player's life total becomes 10.

cards.name: Malfegor
cards.text:
Flying
When Malfegor enters the battlefield, discard your hand. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each card discarded this way.
cards.flavor: A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.

rulings.text: Malfegor's ability is not optional. You must discard your entire hand no matter how many creatures your opponents control.

After you discard your hand and the number of creatures each opponent must sacrifice has been determined, each opponent in turn order, starting with the player whose turn it is if that player is your opponent, chooses which creatures they will sacrifice, then all the chosen creatures are all sacrificed at the same time.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Malfegor comes into play, discard your hand. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Meglonoth
cards.text:
Vigilance, trample
Whenever Meglonoth blocks a creature, Meglonoth deals damage to that creature's controller equal to Meglonoth's power.
cards.flavor: When the shards merged, Mayael found herself the general of Naya's mightiest army.

rulings.text: You don't check Meglonoth's power until its triggered ability resolves.
If Meglonoth leaves the battlefield after its ability triggers but before it resolves, the amount of damage it deals is equal to its power as it last existed on the battlefield.
If Meglonoth somehow blocks more than one creature, its ability will trigger once for each creature it blocks.

cards.originalText:
Vigilance, trample
Whenever Meglonoth blocks a creature, Meglonoth deals damage to that creature's controller equal to Meglonoth's power.

cards.name: Nacatl Outlander
cards.text: Protection from blue
cards.flavor: Survival in the wilds of Naya left Tiyan well equipped to win the civilized battles of Bant.
cards.originalText: Protection from blue

cards.name: Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker
cards.text:
+3: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
−2: Gain control of target creature.
−9: Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker deals 7 damage to target player or planeswalker. That player or that planeswalker's controller discards seven cards, then sacrifices seven permanents.

rulings.text: The control-change effect has no duration. It will last until the game ends or the affected creature leaves the battlefield. It may be superseded by a later control-change effect.

If the damage from Nicol Bolas's third ability is prevented or redirected, the rest of the effect will still happen. Specifically, the number of cards discarded and permanents sacrificed isn't tied to the amount of damage dealt.

For the third ability, if the player is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, the ability doesn't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt, no cards will be discarded, and no permanents will be sacrificed.

foreignNames.name: プレインズウォーカー、ニコル・ボーラス

cards.originalText:
+3: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
-2: Gain control of target creature.
-9: Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker deals 7 damage to target player. That player discards seven cards, then sacrifices seven permanents.

cards.name: Progenitus
cards.text:
Protection from everything
If Progenitus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Progenitus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.
cards.flavor: The Soul of the World has returned.

rulings.text: "Protection from everything" means the following: Progenitus can't be blocked, Progenitus can't be enchanted or equipped, Progenitus can't be the target of spells or abilities, and all damage that would be dealt to Progenitus is prevented.
Progenitus can still be affected by effects that don't target it or deal damage to it (such as Day of Judgment).

cards.originalText:
Protection from everything
If Progenitus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Progenitus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.name: Rhox Bodyguard
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Rhox Bodyguard enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: An enlightened soul caged in a body made for battle.

foreignNames.name: ロウクスのボディガード

cards.originalText:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Rhox Bodyguard comes into play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Scarland Thrinax
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Scarland Thrinax.
cards.flavor:
"There is only one way of life in Jund: feed on the weak until you are cut down by something stronger."
—Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

foreignNames.name: 傷跡の地のトリナクス

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Scarland Thrinax.

cards.name: Shambling Remains
cards.text:
Shambling Remains can't block.
Unearth {B}{R} ({B}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Shambling Remains can't block.
Unearth {B}{R} ({B}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to play. It gains haste. Remove it from the game at end of turn or if it would leave play. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Skyward Eye Prophets
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: They lament the doom that is coming to Bant without realizing the part their own leaders have played in it.

foreignNames.name: Prophètes de l'Œil tourné vers le Ciel

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
{T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it into play. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Sludge Strider
cards.text: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control or another artifact you control leaves the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Underneath the cities of Esper are cycles of life unseen by those who feed them.

rulings.text: If Sludge Strider and another artifact enter the battlefield under your control at the same time, Sludge Strider's triggered ability will trigger. Similarly, if Sludge Strider and another artifact you control leave the battlefield at the same time, Sludge Strider's triggered ability will trigger.

If an artifact creature with 0 toughness enters the battlefield under your control, Sludge Strider's ability will trigger a total of twice: Once when that creature enters the battlefield, and once when it's put into a graveyard. Both abilities will be put on the stack after the state-based action check that puts the 0-toughness creature into the graveyard is finished.

cards.originalText: Whenever another artifact comes into play under your control or another artifact you control leaves play, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Sphinx Summoner
cards.text:
Flying
When Sphinx Summoner enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The card you find must be both an artifact and a creature.

foreignNames.name: スフィンクスの召喚士

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sphinx Summoner comes into play, you may search your library for an artifact creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Suicidal Charge
cards.text: Sacrifice Suicidal Charge: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn. Those creatures attack this turn if able.
cards.flavor:
"They think they're winning. But they're just lining up to be dinner."
—Rakka Mar

rulings.text: Suicidal Charge's ability affects only the creatures your opponents control at the time it resolves. If another creature comes under the control of one of those players by the time that turn's combat step begins, it won't have to attack.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Suicidal Charge: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn. Those creatures attack this turn if able.

cards.name: Vagrant Plowbeasts
cards.text: {1}: Regenerate target creature with power 5 or greater.
cards.flavor: Plowbeasts of Naya escaped their harnesses in droves, content to snack on the conveniently cultivated fields of Eos and Valeron.

rulings.text: This ability checks the targeted creature's power only at the time the ability is activated and at the time it resolves. The regeneration shield it creates will work no matter what that creature's power is at the time it would be destroyed.

cards.originalText: {1}: Regenerate target creature with power 5 or greater.

cards.name: Valeron Outlander
cards.text: Protection from black
cards.flavor: After years of honing her philosophy in debate with stubborn rhoxes, Niella was ready to convert any heathen.
cards.originalText: Protection from black

cards.name: Vectis Agents
cards.text: {U}{B}: Vectis Agents gets -2/-0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: With their life energy suppressed under their etherium enhancements, thieves from Esper found it surprisingly easy to explore the ruins of Grixis.

foreignNames.name: ヴェクティスの工作員

cards.originalText: {U}{B}: Vectis Agents gets -2/-0 until end of turn and is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Vedalken Outlander
cards.text: Protection from red
cards.flavor: The Seekers of Carmot searched across the unknown lands for the mystical red stone that could reforge Esper in ethereal perfection.

cards.name: Zombie Outlander
cards.text: Protection from green
cards.flavor: The ripe smell of life drifted into Grixis. The dead caught the scent and with reckless hunger followed it back into Jund.
cards.originalText: Protection from green

cards.name: Armillary Sphere
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Armillary Sphere: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The mysterious purpose of two of the rings had eluded Esper mages—until now.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Armillary Sphere: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: In a world where death is always violent, cruel weapons are as common as rocks.

Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Font of Mythos
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws two additional cards.
cards.flavor: Those who drink from Malfegor's cup are tainted with hunger and stained with lies.

rulings.text: The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws two additional cards.

cards.name: Kaleidostone
cards.text:
When Kaleidostone enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Kaleidostone: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.
cards.flavor: Once broken, who knows what worlds might grow from its shards?

cards.text:
Domain — Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor: As the shards merged, relics once thought mundane regained forgotten powers.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText:
Domain Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Obelisk of Alara
cards.text:
{1}{W}, {T}: You gain 5 life.
{1}{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

{1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}, {T}: Obelisk of Alara deals 3 damage to target player.
{1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ancient Ziggurat
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell.
cards.flavor: Built in honor of Alara's creatures, the ziggurat vanished long ago. When Progenitus awakened, the temple emerged again.

rulings.text: Mana produced by Ancient Ziggurat can be spent on any part of a creature spell's total cost. This includes additional costs (such as kicker) and alternative costs (such as evoke or Worldheart Phoenix's alternative cost).
Mana produced by Ancient Ziggurat can't be spent on activated abilities that put a creature card directly onto the battlefield, such as unearth or ninjutsu.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to play creature spells.

cards.name: Exotic Orchard
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.flavor:
"It was a strange morning. When we awoke, we found our trees transformed. We didn't know whether to water them or polish them."
—Pulan, Bant orchardist

rulings.text: The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Exotic Orchard can't be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.

Exotic Orchard checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color." If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Exotic Orchard, you can tap Exotic Orchard for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.

When determining what colors of mana your opponents' lands could produce, Exotic Orchard takes into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands' mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there are more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Exotic Orchard doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your opponents' lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

Lands that produce mana based only on what other lands "could produce" won't help each other unless some other land allows one of them to actually produce some type of mana. For example, if you control an Exotic Orchard and your opponent controls an Exotic Orchard and a Reflecting Pool, none of those lands would produce mana if their mana abilities were activated. On the other hand, if you control a Forest and an Exotic Orchard, and your opponent controls an Exotic Orchard and a Reflecting Pool, then each of those lands can be tapped to produce {G}. Your opponent's Exotic Orchard can produce {G} because you control a Forest. Your Exotic Orchard and your opponent's Reflecting Pool can each produce {G} because your opponent's Exotic Orchard can produce {G}.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.name: Reliquary Tower
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {C}.
cards.flavor: When the aven scouts located the tower in Esper, the Knights of the Reliquary set off on a righteous crusade to recover their lost treasures.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Reliquary Tower onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents enter the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rupture Spire
cards.text:
Rupture Spire enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rupture Spire enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Rupture Spire comes into play tapped.
When Rupture Spire comes into play, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Unstable Frontier
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The goblins went to sleep in Jund and awoke in Grixis. They'd never seen a zombie before. They would never see one again.

rulings.text: You choose a basic land type as the ability resolves.

The affected land loses its existing land types and any abilities printed on it. It becomes the chosen basic land type and now has the ability to tap to add one mana of the appropriate color to your mana pool. Unstable Frontier's ability doesn't change the affected land's name or whether it's legendary or basic.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Arena of the Ancients
cards.text:
Legendary creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
When Arena of the Ancients enters the battlefield, tap all legendary creatures.
cards.originalText: When Arena of the Ancients comes into play, tap all legends. Legends do not untap during their controllers' untap phase.

cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}.
cards.originalText: {0}: Sacrifice a creature to add two colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered them.

rulings.text: It's the ability, not the counter that makes the creature an artifact. The creature remains an artifact even if the +1/+1 counter is removed.

cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant to put a +1/+1 counter on target non-artifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact creature, although it retains its color.

cards.name: Barl's Cage
cards.text: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.

rulings.text: Does not prevent a creature from untapping at other times. It just stops the "normal" untap during the untap step.
You may target any creature with this ability. It doesn't have to be tapped.
If the targeted creature is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when the targeted creature is tapped.

Barl's Cage doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: {3}: Target creature does not untap during its controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Book of Rass
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

rulings.text: You can't spend yourself to below zero life. You can't spend life you don't have.

cards.originalText: {2}: Pay 2 life to draw a card. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Bronze Horse
cards.text:
Trample
As long as you control another creature, prevent all damage that would be dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it.
cards.originalText:
Trample
As long as you control any other creatures, damage dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it is reduced to 0.

cards.name: Feldon's Cane
cards.text: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier.
cards.originalText: {T}: Reshuffle your graveyard into your library. Remove Feldon's Cane from the game.

cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The Fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Gain 1 life.

cards.name: Gauntlets of Chaos
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice Gauntlets of Chaos: Exchange control of target artifact, creature, or land you control and target permanent an opponent controls that shares one of those types with it. If those permanents are exchanged this way, destroy all Auras attached to them.

rulings.text: As you activate the ability, the targets you choose must be two artifacts, two creatures, or two lands. As the ability resolves, both targets will be legal only if they are two artifacts, two creatures, or two lands at that time as well, though they may be a different type than they were at the time the ability was activated. For example, if the targets were a creature and an artifact creature when the ability was activated, but the first target became a noncreature artifact by the time the ability resolves, both targets will still be legal (since they're both artifacts).

If one of the targets is illegal by the time the ability resolves (because the wrong player controls it, or it's the wrong card type, or for any other reason), the exchange doesn't happen. The target that's still legal will remain under its controller's control. Since the exchange doesn't happen, no Auras are destroyed. (If both targets are illegal, the ability doesn't resolve.)

cards.originalText: {5}: Sacrifice Gauntlets of Chaos. Choose a target artifact, creature, or land opponent controls and a target permanent you control of the same type. Exchange control of these permanents. Bury any enchantments played on these permanents.

cards.name: Horn of Deafening
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature deals no damage in combat this turn.

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Draw a card; then, choose and discard a card from your hand.
